review_title: Great place to work while attending school.
pros:
I've worked in several offices around campus, all of my experiences have been overwhelmingly positive.
-Flexible schedule (you often set your own hours). 
-Willing to work with you if you have tests or papers due and are overwhelmed. 
-Gain experience working with the public, most students staff front desks and answer phones.
-Often get to interact with professors and other influential people on campus, you get to know them pretty well. 
-The connections you make are often beneficial in job searching after graduation. 
-Great way to get references. 
-I have made many lasting friendships through working on campus with fellow student employees. 
-Most supervisors have at least a bachelor's degree and understand the stresses of balancing education and employment.
cons: It's very difficult to obtain a job here if you are not eligible to be paid with Federal Work Study funds. If you aren't a FWS student your hours are sometimes limited due to budgetary constraints.

job_title: Director, IUP Community Music School; Part-time Faculty In Music in Indiana, PA
pros: Great colleagues;  staff and faculty really care about doing the best work they can;  students come first;  staff and faculty supervisors take care with people who work under them;  students get to work with professors exclusively (there are no graduate teaching assistants here);  campus is constantly being renovated/renewed;  very fine academic programs in many fields (I know the music and speech departments primarily but there are many others);  Indiana is a nice small town that is quite affordable, attractive, and has a flourishing, artistic downtown.
cons: Sadly, IUP is over an hour's drive to the great city of PIttsburgh.  I wish it were closer.

review_title: A job that calls for detail.
pros: I've learned a lot about web analytics in a short amount of time under my boss, the web director of my university. I love that I  am mantaining the overall appearance and mobility of the university website. I've worked in SEO, basic editing, site content mapping, and have knowledge of HTML 5 coding, and am now given responsibility to do certain IT help tickets as they come in from different departments.
cons: If you're not keen on detail, this isn't a good job for you.  Thoroughness is a must. You learn as you work.

pros: Because of being a student worker, they work really well with your schedule. Also, since it's an on campus job, so it's super easy to get to by walking.
cons: You only make minimum wage, which is understandable, but I really wish there was room to grow.  Other than that I can't really complain. If you don't already have your clearances, you need to get them, or you won't be hired.

pros: This is a good position for students to have income while completing their degree. It is excellent real world experience to add to your resume in a relevant field of study.
cons: The cons of working part time for a university is you are only employed for as long as you are a student. When you graduate you are left unemployed until a new job is obtained.

job_title: ESL Instructor/Tutoring Program Supervisor in Indiana, PA
pros: The office culture within the American Language Institute is fantastic. The assistant director is organized, supportive and responsive. Some instructors are doctoral candidates while others are working professionals. All members of this community care for incoming ESL students and demonstrate strong commitment to their academic, professional and linguistic improvement.
cons: There are few full-time opportunities available. Part-time employees sign contracts each semester and their pay dates are staggered.

review_title: A great place to grind MLA and APA standards into yourself and be pleasantly surprised by the English language.
pros: Laid back atmosphere, got to meet and interact with a range of students, learned more about sentence structure. Composition of international students would usually show me ways of saying things that I hadn't imagined.
cons:
Having to explain that sometimes that's just how English was, there's no explanation, it just is.

Continually explaining we weren't an editing service, then dealing with students that were told by their professors that we were.

review_title: Excellent!  The staff and faculty are always very helpful!
job_title: Adjunct Spanish Instructor in Indiana, PA
pros: I am very pleased with IUP's commitment to education and scholarly growth.
cons: Adjuncts do not know if, or when, there may be an opening based on budget concerns (which is more of a state budget issue).

pros: Laid back atmosphere, clear expectations, willing to work around your schedule, the timing was the most important factor as there are few available positions you must apply quickly.
cons: The only major con would be the pay, but what is to be expected, it was a student job which worked around a class schedule so even the little compensation that it was proved helpful.

pros: All of my coworkers and my employers are extremely nice and helpful, schedule works around my class schedule, helped me get to know how things at the college work, non-stressful atmosphere
cons: I'm a student worker, therefore, no paid time off, no benefits, no increases in pay, and can have to deal with extremely rude students/guardians at times

pros: Great colleagues and administration.  Supportive, flexible, enthusiastic.  The College of Fine Arts and the Department of Music continually strives to be the best it can be through conscientious actions and decision-making, and respect for and encouragement of students and faculty.
cons: There are no cons to working in the Department of Music or the College of Fine Arts.

pros: Able to study at work. Built great relationships and professional contacts. Able to make money while still working towards an education.
cons: Working with coworkers who were full time employees and not student workers could be difficult at times.

pros: Caring people, great students, lots of opportunity to serve and research. The new president is well-liked and responsive. I have no interest in working anywhere else.
cons: As anywhere, there are those people to avoid...and you can do so in this environment. Money-woes abound, but this too is normal in education today.

review_title: Case Study of Out of Touch, Actions Don't Meet Words Leadership
pros: Fellow workers. And all the fellow workers feel the disconnect from what the organization says it is about and what it actually is about . . . other than reacting when they have to.
cons: See headline. visionary leadership lacks any vision but ride the decline hoping for a bottom somewhere while throwing others overboard and giving themselves raises. And PA taxpayers are paying for this and they supposedly represent "talent"

review_title: IUP: Overall, great place to work!
pros: Good people and great mission.
cons: Significant lack of resources for getting the job done in many departments.
